titleproper.value: Guide to the David Jaffin Papers <num>MC.261</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-08-08T19:04:27</date>

extent.value: in 1 record carton, 4 manuscript boxes, and 1 folder in a shared box

abstract.value: Dr. David Jaffin (1937- ) is a New York-born author and pastor. Jaffin earned his Ph.D. from New York University and later moved to Germany to study theology at Tuebingen University. He became a pastor in the Lutheran Church and served as a minister in Wuettemberg for 20 years. Jaffin writes sermons, religious texts, and German prose, as well as poetry in English. This collection consists of original poetry produced by Dr. David Jaffin in the early 21st century, including both notebooks and published works.

p.value: Identification of item, date; David Jaffin Papers; MC 261; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

Donated by Dr. David Jaffin in December of 2015; the accession number associated with this gift is 2016.001. Further accretions were received in 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019; the accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2017.030, 2018.026, 2018.037, 2018.038, 2019.030, and 2019.081.

Dr. David Jaffin (1937- ) is a New York-born author and pastor. Jaffin earned his Ph.D. from New York University and later moved to Germany to study theology at Tuebingen University. He became a pastor in the Lutheran Church and served as a minister in Wuettemberg for 20 years. Jaffin writes sermons, religious texts, and German prose, as well as poetry in English.
This collection consists of original poetry produced by Dr. David Jaffin in the early 21st century, including both notebooks and published works.
